newsitem.title: NORWAY: Bad weather stops Statfjord, Gullfaks oil loadings.
newsitem.headline: Bad weather stops Statfjord, Gullfaks oil loadings.

text.p: Stormy weather halted offshore crude loadings at the North Sea Statfjord and Gullfaks oilfields early on Tuesday but production remained at normal levels, operator Den norske stats oljeselskap ASA (Statoil) said.
"We were loading up to this morning but the weather is bad at the moment," said Statoil spokesman Odd Jan Lange. "But there are no production problems and there is a lot of storage capacity."
Lange said the main Statfjord field pumped 471,750 barrels on Monday, with the Statfjord North and East satellites adding a further 125,800 barrels.
Production at Saga Petroleum's Snorre field, which feeds crude to Statfjord for processing and transportation, produced 228,880 barrels.

Output at the Gullfaks development was still returning to normal following a scheduled maintenance shutdown. Production on Monday amounted to 377,400 barrels, about 70,000 barrels short of usual levels.
Lange said the weather was expected to improve around midnight. Two shuttle tankers were in the area ready to load, he said.
